author: sina_mobile
title: 云南人工种植森林蔬菜年产值约10亿元_手机新浪网
text:
云南人工种植森林蔬菜年产值约10亿元
本报讯 首席记者廖兴阳报道 4月23日，来自云南省发展和改革委员会的消息，截至目前，云南省人工种植森林蔬菜面积约50万亩，年产值约10亿元，成为推动林下经济发展的新突破口和农民增收的重要渠道。
为推动林下经济发展，省发展改革委积极支持省林科院以森林蔬菜开发为突破口，着力开展资源调查、良种选育，林下种植模式及高效种植技术开发、产品研发，以科技助力森林蔬菜产业发展。具体来说，在滇中、滇南区域建成全省最大木本森林蔬菜种质资源收集圃，收集保存木本森林蔬菜40种；选育出“狮山”金雀花、“碧溪”刺五加2个良种并获省级审定；筛选出金雀花、刺五加、大参、梁王茶、长蕊甜菜、守宫木、大果榕7个适宜林下种植的森林蔬菜种类。同时，构建森林蔬菜种植模式和培育技术体系，包括建立试验示范基地1000亩，形成高效培育技术体系8个；在核桃林，开展云南松、思茅松人工商品林林下种植试验，总结形成初植密度、种植修剪管理、林地管理、绿色防控等种植管理技术；开展繁育技术研究，20余种森林蔬菜形成高效稳定的繁育技术，近3年培育优质苗木100万株。
此外，着力推动成果落地转化。森林蔬菜高效培育技术入选国家林业科技推广成果库，在昆明、楚雄、文山、红河、普洱、德宏、西双版纳等多个州（市）推广实施，带动发展种植1万余亩，有效拓展山区特色经济发展模式，助力乡村振兴。
截至目前，全省人工种植面积较大的森林蔬菜有香椿、楤木、花椒、刺五加、羽叶金合欢、守宫木、棠梨、扁核木等20余种，总面积约50万亩，年产值约10亿元。从事森林蔬菜种植销售相关企业达40余家，生产经营合作社达300余家，个体种植户数量庞大，涉及100万人以上。2024年，云南省林下经济规模化经营和利用林地面积约5500万亩，总产值约1800亿元，占林草产业总产值的32.1%，同比增长2.2%，林药、林菌、林菜、林禽、竹笋、林下采集（含木本油料）、森林旅游等发展模式已具规模。
据介绍，下一步，省发展改革委将继续通过争取生态保护修复专项中央预算内投资、林草领域地方政府专项债券等方式，持续对森林蔬菜产业提供项目支撑，并配合省林草局加快推进集体林权制度改革，推动落实公益林发展林下经济管理规定，明确利用二级国家公益林、地方公益林发展林下经济的具体要求。

author: Commercialcleaningcompani
title: Shaping Cleanliness: The Role of North West's Top Commercial Cleaners
text:
In today’s rapid world, the importance of maintaining a spotless and healthy workspace has been more important. Situated in the heart of the North West, a region known for its bustling cities and scenic landscapes, lies an overlooked hero of the business world: commercial cleaners. These professionals are the backbone of maintaining immaculate work environments, contributing not just to aesthetics but also to health and productivity. In this post, we explore the world of commercial cleaners in the North West, exploring their vital role and why they should be at the forefront of every business owner’s mind.
The Foundation of Professional Cleaning
Commercial cleaning services are more than just the basics of dusting and mopping. They encompass a range of tasks customised to the unique needs of each business, from deep cleaning carpets to sanitizing workstations. The cleaners in the North West are furnished with the latest tools and techniques, ensuring that every nook and cranny of your workplace is spotless. This level of cleanliness is not just about appearances; it's a commitment to providing a safe and healthy environment for employees and clients alike.
Why Select North West Cleaning Experts?
Expertise and Experience: With years of experience, North West’s commercial cleaners bring a wealth of knowledge to every job. They are trained in the latest cleaning methods and use cutting-edge equipment, ensuring thorough cleaning.
Customised Solutions: Understanding that no two businesses are alike, these cleaners offer bespoke cleaning plans. Whether it’s a small office or a large industrial space, they have the skills and resources to meet your specific requirements.
Sustainable Practices: In an era where environmental consciousness is essential, many North West cleaners adopt eco-friendly cleaning methods. This approach not only maintains hygiene but also helps in reducing your carbon footprint.
Health and Safety Compliance: These professionals are well-versed in health and safety regulations, ensuring that their cleaning practices comply with the highest standards. This is especially crucial in industries where hygiene is essential, such as healthcare and food service.
The Effect on Business
A clean workspace is not just about making a good impression. It has tangible benefits that can impact the bottom line of your business:
Boosts Productivity: A clean and organised environment can greatly improve employee productivity and morale.
Reduces Illness: Regular cleaning reduces the spread of germs, leading to fewer sick days and a healthier workforce.
Protects Assets: Proper maintenance of your premises and equipment can increase their longevity, saving costs in the long run.
Choosing the Right Cleaning Service
When selecting a commercial cleaner in the North West, consider the following:
Reputation: Look for cleaners with favorable reviews and testimonials.
Flexibility: Choose a service that can work around your business hours and specific needs.
Insurance: Ensure they are fully insured to protect against any accidental damage.
Cost: While cost is a factor, remember that the cheapest option is not always the best. Quality and reliability are key.
Wrapping Up: The Vital Role of Commercial Cleaners
Commercial cleaners in the North West are more than just service providers; they are partners in your business’s success. By maintaining a clean and healthy workspace, they help create an environment where businesses can thrive. In choosing the right commercial cleaning service, you’re not just investing in cleanliness; you’re investing in the health, productivity, and longevity of your business.
Keep in mind, a tidy workspace is a productive workspace!
On the lookout for commercial cleaning? Click the link -
commercial cleaning cumbria.

author: Evelyn Blackwell
title: First North Korean Troops Reach Russian Combat Zone, Kyiv Reports - WorldNewsEra
text: [Europe](../) First North Korean troops reach Russian combat zone, Kyiv reports The EU has condemned this move as a violation of international law. The first North Korean military units trained in eastern Russia have arrived in the combat zone, Kyiv reported on Thursday. North Korean soldiers were already spotted in Russia’s border region of Kursk on Wednesday, The Ukrainian Defence Ministry’s Main Directorate of Intelligence said. According to Ukrainian authorities, Pyongyang troops arriving in Russia are being trained at five military training grounds located in the country’s east. The soldiers whom Russia intends to use in the war against Ukraine are given several weeks of training before their deployment. The number of North Korean troops stationed in Russia currently totals around 12,000, including 500 officers as well as three generals, according to Ukrainian intelligence information. Russian Deputy Defence Minister Yunus-Bek Yevkurov has reportedly been assigned the task of overseeing the training of North Korean troops. Pyongyang is supplying the soldiers with ammunition, bedding, winter clothing and footwear, and hygiene products. Moscow is also providing each North Korean soldier with standard rations of 50 metres of toilet paper and 300 grams of soap each month, authorities claim. Ukrainian intelligence believes that the Kremlin has high hopes for North Korean reinforcements in its war against Ukraine. The authorities in Kyiv, including President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, have repeatedly warned that Pyongyang is sending its troops to get involved in the fighting. South Korea and the US have also previously warned of the impending deployment of North Korean troops to the Ukrainian front. Putin: ‘What we do is our business’ Russian President Vladimir Putin, at a press conference following the BRICS summit in Kazan, commented for the first time on reports about the presence of soldiers from North Korea in Russian territory for deployment in its full-scale invasion of Ukraine. An NBC News correspondent at the conference asked the Russian leader about the military’s goals, citing satellite images purporting to show Pyongyang soldiers in Russia. “Imagery is a serious thing. If there are images, it means they reflect something,” Putin said. The Russian president also noted that the State Duma ratified a strategic partnership treaty with North Korea on Thursday. The treaty includes an article on mutual military assistance. “We have never doubted that the North Korean leadership takes our agreements seriously,” Putin said, “but what and how we will do is already our business within the framework of this article.” European Union ‘alarmed’ “The European Union is deeply alarmed by reports that North Korea is sending troops to participate in Russia’s illegal war of aggression against Ukraine,” the EU’s High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Josep Borrell said in a statement. “This would be a serious violation of international law, including the most fundamental principles of the UN Charter,” Borrell said, warning of “serious consequences for European and global peace and security”. The EU strongly condemns the deepening military cooperation between Pyongyang and Moscow and arms transfers, which flagrantly violate numerous UN Security Council resolutions, he added. The EU “will coordinate its actions with international partners on this issue, including retaliatory measures,” Borrell concluded. [World News](/)|| [Latest News](/news)|| [U.S. News](../../us-news) [Source link](//www.euronews.com/my-europe/2024/10/24/first-north-korean-troops-reach-russian-combat-zone-kyiv-reports)

author: Toni Planells
title: Tradición, baile y sabores ibicencos conquistan a los turistas en ses Figueretes
text: Un momento de la 'ballada' durante la muestra para el Día del Turista. | Toni Planells Este jueves por la tarde, el paseo de [ses Figueretes](/etiqueta/ses+Figueretes.html?utm_source=Inline-tag&utm_medium=internal) fue el escenario de una de las actividades más esperadas dentro de la celebración del [Día del Turista](/etiqueta/D%C3%ADa+del+Turista.html?utm_source=Inline-tag&utm_medium=internal) en [Ibiza](/etiqueta/ibiza.html?utm_source=Inline-tag&utm_medium=internal). A las 19.00 horas, el Grupo Folklòric Sa Bodega ofreció una ‘ballada pagesa’ que sorprendió a decenas de visitantes que paseaban por la zona. Con gran curiosidad, teléfono móvil en mano, decenas de sorprendidos viajeros se detuvieron para admirar el baile tradicional ibicenco. Mientras los 'pagesos' saltaban alrededor de las 'pageses', alguien en la multitud las comparaba con princesas, por sus vestidos y porte elegante. Tras la exhibición, que despertó la admiración de los presentes, los asistentes pudieron disfrutar de una degustación de productos locales. Marga Orell, cocinera ibicenca, fue la encargada de preparar tres deliciosas muestras de su cocina, utilizando productos de temporada. El menú incluyó un refrescante gazpacho de melón con pimiento, cebolla, pepino y ajo; una ‘coca de pebrera’ elaborada con harina de 'xeixa' y algarroba y, como postre, un bizcocho de algarroba que dejó a más de uno queriendo repetir.

author: irpino
title: Flumeri, danneggiata la Natività, gambe spezzate a Gesù Bambino
text:
Comunità indignata e sconcertata per il deprecabile atto vandalico compiuto in Campo Giglio. Qualcuno ha danneggiato la Natività luminosa ma soprattutto il Gesù Bambino adagiato nella mangiatoia. Gli sono state spezzate le gambe.
Senza parole il sindaco di Flumeri, Angelo Lanza, nel pubblicare sulla sua pagina facebook la foto dello scempio. Parole di incredulità ma soprattutto di rabbia, invece nei commenti dei cittadini. Ce la si prende con la mancanza di valori e di educazione da parte dei ragazzi. Ma al momento non è dato sapere chi è l’autore o gli autori del gesto che è a tutti gli effetti sacrilego poiché è stato toccato il simbolo per eccellenza del Natale e della fede cristiana, Gesù.
Qualcuno invoca telecamere e giustizia affinchè i colpevoli vengano individuati e puniti. Il sindaco replica che «saranno visionate, ma il punto resta un altro, servirebbe educare e non punire».
Dunque telecamere presenti e funzionanti, immagini al vaglio della Polizia municipale. Sicuramente ci sarà un colpevole e ciò che tutti vorranno chiedergli è «perchè».
